location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 1740/1915 Pt 2 'Arabia: Proposed appointment of a British Vice Consul to Mokalla'

mods.abstract: This part contains correspondence and other papers relating to British policy in the Hadramaut (also written Hadhramaut and Hadhramut) region of Yemen. The papers cover: the proposal for and appointment of a Vice-Consul at Mokalla [Al Mukalla]; the division of cost for such an appointment; a treaty between the Kathiri and Kaaiti [Al Qu'ayṭī] tribes; a proposal for payment of a subsidy to Sultan Ghalib of Shehr and Mokalla [Ghālib bin Awad Al Qu'ayṭī]; and issues of travel and sending remittances for Hadramauti Arabs in the Dutch East Indies.The principal correspondents are officials at the India Office, Foreign Office, and Colonial Office. Further correspondence, included as enclosures, comes from: the High Commissioner, Cairo; the Arab Bureau, Cairo; and the Consul General, Batavia.Notable within the file are the following sketch maps:'Sketch Map of Hadhramut' (folio 50)'Tribal Sketch Map of Hadhramut' (folio 50)'Sketch Map of Wadi Doan' (folio 51).
